name: Surgical Avoidance Strategies in Vascular Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
description: Vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome presents unique surgical challenges due to extreme tissue fragility. Tissues do not hold sutures well, bleed excessively, and heal poorly. The fundamental principle is to avoid surgery whenever possible. When intervention is unavoidable, meticulous technique, experienced surgical teams, and modified approaches are essential. Endovascular options may be preferred in some scenarios, though they carry their own risks.

rationale: Tissue fragility leads to suture pullthrough
fundamental_principle.mortality_risk: Surgical mortality rates significantly higher than general population

presentation: Arterial rupture or dissection without preceding dilation
Thin translucent skin with visible veins
Easy bruising and poor wound healing
diagnosis: Clinical features (thin skin, bruising, family history)
Avoid invasive diagnostic procedures when possible

general.dissection: Tissues tear easily with minimal force

indications: Expanding hemorrhage not controlled with compression

decision_making.endovascular_consideration: May be preferable to open surgery in some cases
decision_making.experienced_team: Essential - should not be performed by inexperienced surgeons

conduit_selection.avoid_vein_harvest: Minimizes additional incisions and tissue trauma
conduit_selection.prosthetic: May be preferred despite usual preference for vein

bowel_anastomosis.ostomy: Low threshold for diverting stoma rather than primary anastomosis

arterial_hemorrhage.observation: Small contained hematomas may be observed
arterial_hemorrhage.angiographic_embolization: May control hemorrhage without open surgery

bowel_perforation.limited_cases: Some selected small perforations with localized peritonitis
bowel_perforation.caution: Most perforations require surgery, but minimize extent

aneurysm_management.rationale: Rupture may occur at any size - surgery has high risk regardless

when_to_consider: Selected cases where open surgery risks prohibitive

center_of_excellence.recommendation: Refer to specialized centers with vEDS experience
rationale: Better outcomes documented at high-volume centers

clinical_pearls: AVOID surgery whenever possible - mortality risk is very high
Never clamp vessels directly - use balloon occlusion
Use pledgeted sutures and avoid ANY tension on tissues
Colonoscopy carries significant perforation risk - avoid electively
learning_objectives: Justify conservative management as first-line approach in vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome
Describe surgical technique modifications for unavoidable operations in vEDS
Identify elective procedures that should be avoided in vEDS patients
